page.title: 01Shapinsay-Orkneys
page.content: This 4km x 3km block of land on the east side of Shapinsay Island is typical of the low rolling hills seen in all the Orkneys. It consists nearly entirely now of intensively managed grassland which is common of todays farming practice in this land. There is a strip of rough grazing along the low rocky cliffs which stretch along this section. There are approx. 4 inhabited farms, but the remains of several older houses show that it has been origionally more densely populated and there is the history of some fishing having been done. The remains of a 12th century chapel near the shore suggest that it was a very early settlement perhaps by the norse. There are no photographic features of any note.
